gurmukhi: ਦੁਹਾ ਕੰਧਾਰਾਂ ਮੁਹਿ ਜੁੜੇ; ਅਣੀਅਾ ਰਾਚੋੲੀਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Duhaa Kandhaaraa Muh(i) Jude Aneeaaraan Choeeaan||
translation: Both the armies are facing each other and the blood is dripping from the tips of arrows.

gurmukhi: ਧੂਹਿ ਕਿਰਪਾਣਾ ਤ੍ਨਿਖੀਅਾਂ; ਨਾਲ ਲੋਹੂ ਧੋੲੀਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Dhooh(i) Kirpaanaan Tikkheeaan Naal Lohoo Dhoeeaan||
translation: Pulling the sharp swords, they have been washed with blood.

gurmukhi: ਹੂਰਾਂ ਸ੍ਰਣਵਤਬੀਜ ਨੂੰ; ਘਤਿ ਘੇਰਿ ਖਲੋੲੀਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Hooraan Sranvat Beej Noon Ghat(i) Gher(i) Khaloeeaan||
translation: The heavenly damsels (houris), surrounding Sranwat Beej, are standing;
Like the brides surrounding the bridegroom in order to see him.42.
The drummer beat the trumpet and armies attacked each other.
With their hands they pulled the naked sword and caused their dance.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਿਅਾਂ ਦੇ ਤਨ ਲਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਗੋਸਤ ਗਿੱਧੀਅਾਂ ॥ ਬਿੱਧਣਰਾਤੀ ਅਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਮਰਦਾਂ ਘੋੜਿਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Sooriaan De Tan Laaeeaan Goshat Giddheeaan||
translation: These devourers of meat were struck on the bodies of the warriors.
The nights of agony have come for the men and horses.
The Yoginis have come together speedily in order to drink the blood.

gurmukhi: ਭਜਦੀ ਕਥਾ ਸੁਣਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਰਾਜੇ ਸੰੁਭ ਥੈ ॥
translation: They told the story of their repulsion before the king Sumbh.

gurmukhi: ਭੁੲੀਂ ਨ ਪੳੁਣੈ ਪਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਬੰੂਦਾਂ ਰਕਤ ਦੀਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Bhooeen Na Paounai Paaeeaan Boondaan Rakat Deeaan||
translation: The drops of blood (of Sranwat Beej) could not fall on the earth.
Kali destroyed all the manifestations of (Sranwat Beej) in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਤੀ ਸਿਰੀ ਬਿਹਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਘੜੀਅਾਂ ਕਾਲ ਕੀਅਾਂ ॥
translation: The last moments of death came over the heads of many fighters.
